data.title: Talampaya National Park
data.text: Talampaya National Park is a national park located in the east centre of La Rioja Province Argentina It was designated a provincial reserve in 1975 a national park in 1997 and a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2000 Location The park protects an area of the High Monte ecoregion The park covers an area of at an altitude of above mean sea level Its purpose is to protect important archaeological and palaeontological sites found in the area It has landscapes of great beauty with flora and fauna typical of the mountain biome
